titleStmt.title: Hiram Daugherty et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6506

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisa Kentucky
May 5 1865
To his Excellency T. E. Bramlette,
Governer of Kentucky

Your Petitioners respectfully represent that Isaac L. Collins who is now confined in the State Prison was a that time about 17 years of age, is not of ordinary mind, as we believe and that he was induced by others who were bad men to accompany them and so led astray,

His Parents are quite old, have been driven from their home in Va by the rebels. and lost all, Their reputation is that of Honesty and morality and this affair of their son has been a hard stroke to them,

The boy had seen but little of the world when he was induced away. We believe if he was permitted to to return home he would not again be found going astray, that his punishment has been sufficient and therefore on account of his youth his imbecility of mind and on account of his parents, their age and circumstances in
life we beg his pardon,

Very respectfully &c
. s. carter
Milton Nelson
Majers nolen
Isham Hall
Jackson Mounce
James Neusom
peter Rakes
Eligha Estep
Rutun Datson
